abstract: Former Marine Amir Hekmati, who has been imprisoned in Iran for over three years, says in letter to Iranian Pres Hassan Rouhani that his family has been getting phone calls and emails from Iran proposing prisoner trades for Iranians incarcerated in United States.
lead_paragraph: The family of the former Marine, Amir Hekmati, has been receiving telephone calls and emails from Iran proposing prisoner swaps for Iranians held in the United States, he said in a letter to Iran’s president.
snippet: The family of the former Marine, Amir Hekmati, has been receiving telephone calls and emails from Iran proposing prisoner swaps for Iranians held in the United States, he said in a letter to Iran’s president.

headline.main: Ex-Marine Says Iranians Want a Swap to Free Him
headline.print_headline: Ex-Marine Says Iranians Seek a Swap to Free Him
